It describes the relationship between two elements of a bus that are linked by network nodes or structural definitions.
it describes the relationship between two elements of a bus that are linked by network nodes or structural definitions.
it describes the relationship between two elements of a bus that are linked by network nodes or structural definitions.

A Bus_structural_definition is the aggregate or composition of the mathematical or logical structure of the bus. If a bus were to be represented by a graph, the Bus_structural_definition would be a root node for the bus in that representation. A bus is a composition concept. Once defined, the bus definition can be used in various connectivity related aspects of the design. Several of the possible usages are conflicting and rules are provided to ensure unambiguous data. The structure of the reference model prohibits certain conflicting usages from occurring simultaneously. Ordered definition of buses is supported in this part of ISO 10303 by interpreting the name of the bus element as indicating the position in the sequence, using normal ASCII ordering for regular expressions. Spaces are not allowed in names.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_bus_assignment is the relationship between the structural definition of a bus and the terminal definition of a network to which the bus is assigned.

A Functional_unit_network_terminal_definition_node_assignment is the assignment relationship between a node definition of the functional unit network definition and a terminal definition of that network definition. This assignment provides visibility into the node definition from higher levels in the functional decomposition.

A Functional_unit_terminal_bus_assignment is the relationship between the structural definition of a bus and a terminal that is assigned to the bus. The members of that are assigned to the same bus by this application object are defined to be connected to each other. There are cardinality constraints levied to ensure that the cardinality as resolved through all the references is identical.
